definition: A storage location identified by a name used to hold data.
A block of reusable code that performs a specific task.
A data structure that contains a list of elements of the same type.
A control structure that repeats a block of code.
A blueprint for creating objects in object-oriented programming.
A mechanism in OOP where one class can inherit traits from another.
A program that converts source code into executable code.
A program that directly executes instructions written in a programming language.
A function that calls itself to solve smaller instances of a problem.
example: function factorial(n) { return n <= 1 ? 1 : n * factorial(n - 1); }

definition: An organized collection of structured information or data.
A language used for managing and querying relational databases.
An error or flaw in a software program.
The process of identifying and removing errors from code.
It stands for Central Processing Unit, and it is the "brain" of a computer, responsible for executing instructions and performing calculations
